Reviews.Title: “This is a very good extended stay hotel.”
Reviews.Author: YourNextGuest
Reviews.Content: The staff is great and they run a good tidy ship. It doesn't cost very much, so don't expect the ritz carlton, but the value is great. You'll get a full kitchen in your room, with a large fridge instead of the little ones that you can't fit a pizza into. If you're staying in the area for a little while, this Suburban is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good setup and close to the highway”
Reviews.Author: jandacut
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as the leader of a group of high school students. The rooms were nice in general, very clean and tidy. I stayed in a smoking room on a smoking floor because one of the high schoolers was allergic and had to switch with me, but it wasn't too bad. The stove tops work decent (but you typically have to turn them down lower than you would think), the fridge was great, and the beds were pretty comfortable. This place was pretty full, and so it was pretty noisy with some unwieldy high school groups and some drunk construction workers. If you can't handle smoke, stay out of the top floor. The parking lot doesn't have enough room for large vehicles (busses, RVs, etc) if there are more than two.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Clerk was unprofessional!”
Reviews.Author: Business698
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in, the front desk clerk was bubbly and friendly. However, over the course of my stay, the desk clerk was behaving very unprofessional. One time when I left, I overheard her talking with profaniy. Another time she and some lady with long brown hair was talking loud. There were many times that nobody would be at the front desk. I saw some people waiting at the desk, for awhile, but then left out of frustration. The maintenance guy looked really ragged with his stained Suburban Extended Stay shirt. I should have used my IPhone to capture these moments. Next time, I will stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent month stay!”
Reviews.Author: banston
Reviews.Content: I live in different areas for 1 month at a time around the country for work. This hotel is one of the best. Again my stay was one month. The rooms and buildings are extremely clean and well kept. The service is great. Anytime I needed my room cleaned it was cleaned. The area is very nice with sushi, thai, american, mexican restaurants within 1 mile. A gym within 2-3 miles that is free for guests. There are 2 malls and a movie theatre with 3-4 miles as well. A trader joes and grocery store within 3 miles. Everything you need or want. Cons are that it is close the the interstate with all its noise and the internet is slow. 15 minutes to downtown if you leave for work at 7am. In summary CLEAN, SAFE, GREAT AREA!!.

Reviews.Title: “Overall solid but with a few issues”
Reviews.Author: AlCzervik1
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at this hotel while working on assignment. Overall I enjoyed my stay though I did expect a little more being that the hotel is a Choice Hotels Platinum award winner. If you have never stayed at a Suburban before then this is Choice Hotels budget, extended stay type lodging similar to a Candlewood or Towneplace Suites. Its pretty much a no frills place and the rooms have full kitchens complete with full sized fridge, microwave, 2 burner cook top and dishwasher. The room itself and the bathrooms are smallish but not completely claustrophobic, though you could start bouncing off the walls if your there for more then a couple of weeks I'd imagine. The one thing that really stinks with these hotels in the lighting, the rooms are dark and dreary almost like a cave,why they didn't put better lighting in the design of these hotels, especially considering they get a lot of business travelers, I'll never understand. This is the second Suburban I've stayed at and while not as nice as the first one it was still pretty solid and a good value. The main issues I had were: A: Housekeeping, the housekeeping was subpar, my bathroom had a lot of pubic hair that had not been cleaned up. B: Ants, we couldn't leave any food sitting open on the counter, table, etc or it would be covered in ants in no time. C: Internet speed, the hotel has wired and wireless Internet and while it worked pretty decent the speeds themselves were lousy and incapable of streaming video. The Suburban in Lenxa, KS gives you like 10 Mbps downloads this hotel you get maybe .50 Mbps at best which is pretty awful. You also have to consider this hotel gets very full during the week so that's a lot of people sharing the measly bandwidth. D: Noise, the walls are thin and I was between a howling dog in one room and in the other room was a a guy who was coughing, hacking and spitting 24/7, I found the dogs howling to be more tolerable. Another minor issue I had was with check in. Be prepared to be asked a LOT of questions, why your in town, what company your with, what you do, etc, etc the questions in my opinion went way beyond just small talk and were more like an interrogation of sorts. When your tired after a long day of driving all you want to do is check in and not get hammered with a battery of questions. Other then that my stay was pretty good and at less then $60 a night I thought it was a good deal as well. I loved the hotel location, its at a pretty busy exit with lots of businesses within a close distance. Would I stay there again? Yes, but I might check the price of the Candlewood Suites next door first and if it was a better value I'd probably stay there instead. The Suburban gets very full during the week with construction workers and parking can be a problem but the Candlewood seemed to have plenty of parking available. In fact if you check in late you might find yourself having to park at the Candlewood anyway as there will be no spots available. Ultimately this is a solid hotel but certainly no Platinum Award winner in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel great for multi-week stay situations”
Reviews.Author: mabradford14
Reviews.Content: I recently sold my home and needed a place for 2-3 weeks until the new home I purchased was ready. The Suburban is fairly new and worked out great. They worked with me to get a first floor room near the end of the hall (as I had a 10 yr old Golden Retriever with me) and we stayed about 2.5 weeks. Very helpful and friendly staff. Great empty lots nearby to walk and play with your pet if you have one. You know what you are getting- a one room studio equipped with everything you need except a stove; it's convenient to Castleton shopping and dining. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone needing temporary living.

Reviews.Title: “Great Lake Regional Baseball tournament”
Reviews.Author: AngelaMBrooks
Reviews.Content: WOW! I have stayed at alot of places but this one is at the top. It was clean - the bathrooms were big the sinks were polished and the faucets shined - We had a dish washer, sink, full frig, stove top, and dishes set for 4 people with glasses. I was impressed! I would stay here again for sure if I was in town and for the price we were even more happy. It is located to shopping, and grocery's, the staff were friendly and seemed to stay on top of keeping the place clean. We used the hotel laundry several days we were there and it was a clean place to wash clothes 6 washers and Dryers - Now we are looking for a place to stay this week and I am sure we want be able to find the same quality in the area we are headed. GREAT ! Thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: MrEdnWilbur
Reviews.Content: If you're a business traveler seeking an extended stay hotel, this is the hotel for you! It's appealing factors are best value for money, location, location and location. For $1100 a month, you get a hotel with a stocked kitchenette and a location off 82nd Street & Allisonville which is a major commercial corridor (think hundreds of restaurants, retail shops, auto repair, groceries and bars & nightclubs. Some other pluses are it is pet friendly, a helpful staff and a gym membership a few blocks away. A slight drawback is it gets busy and the parking lot gets filled up at night time. But when that happens, you can always park next door to Candlewood which is owned by the same owners of Suburban

HotelInfo.Name: Suburban Extended Stay N East
HotelInfo.Address: 8055 Bash St, Indianapolis, IN 46250
